name: Vegan Black Forest Chocolate Pudding Cake
description: Vegan Self Saucing Chocolate Pudding meets Black Forest Cake in this easy vegan dessert recipe! This Chocolate Pudding Cake features a chocolatey, almost brownie-like cake, homemade cherry compote and a rich chocolate sauce hidden underneath. Serve warm with ice cream
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon vanilla extract or vanilla bean powder
1/2 cup non-dairy milk (such almond, oat or soy )
3 tablespoons cherry preserves or cherry compote for swirling in (see notes for cherry compote recipe )

recipeInstructions.text: Make the batter : Add the flour, baking powder, soda, salt, sugar, cocoa powder to a bowl and mix well. Add in the wet ingredients - non-dairy milk, oil,  vanilla extract and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the batter : Add the flour, baking powder, soda, salt, sugar, cocoa powder to a bowl and mix well. Add in the wet ingredients - non-dairy milk, oil,  vanilla extract and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: If the batter is too thick, add in milk 1-2 teaspoons at a time to make it somewhat thick muffin like but not too stiff batter.
recipeInstructions.name: If the batter is too thick, add in milk 1-2 teaspoons at a time to make it somewhat thick muffin like but not too stiff batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Grease an 8x8 inch brownie pan or 8-inch round cake pan or a similar-sized pan. Preheat the oven to 350 F (180c).Add the batter to the pan and even it out with a spatula.
recipeInstructions.name: Grease an 8x8 inch brownie pan or 8-inch round cake pan or a similar-sized pan. Preheat the oven to 350 F (180c).Add the batter to the pan and even it out with a spatula.

recipeInstructions.text: Topping: In a bowl, mix the cocoa powder and sugar and distribute it all over this batter. Drizzle cherry preserves or compote.
recipeInstructions.name: Topping: In a bowl, mix the cocoa powder and sugar and distribute it all over this batter. Drizzle cherry preserves or compote.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, add the water and the maple syrup and heat it until it's boiling either in the microwave or you can heat it in the saucepan.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, add the water and the maple syrup and heat it until it's boiling either in the microwave or you can heat it in the saucepan.

recipeInstructions.text: Then pour  the boiling water and maple mixture in the pan over the batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Then pour  the boiling water and maple mixture in the pan over the batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake: Immediately Put pan in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 c ) and bake it for 24-30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake: Immediately Put pan in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 c ) and bake it for 24-30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: The bake time depends on the pan you are using. For the regular metal pans, check at about 24 minutes whether the cake is done. The top should be set and not liquid in the middle. It will be soft and Fudgy pudding at the bottom but the top should be kind of set.
recipeInstructions.name: The bake time depends on the pan you are using. For the regular metal pans, check at about 24 minutes whether the cake is done. The top should be set and not liquid in the middle. It will be soft and Fudgy pudding at the bottom but the top should be kind of set.

recipeInstructions.text: If you are using a thicker pan like a ceramic dish or glass pan then check at 28-30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: If you are using a thicker pan like a ceramic dish or glass pan then check at 28-30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the pan from the oven. Let it sit for 4-5 minutes. Top it with ice cream of choice and serve
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the pan from the oven. Let it sit for 4-5 minutes. Top it with ice cream of choice and serve
